msItem.title: III. Dǝrsan zä-ʾarbaʿtu ʾǝnsǝsa “Homily on the Four Living Creatures”
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the protagonist; name of the commissioner (fols. 3rb, 70vb, 90vb, 99rb); two initial lines in the incipit page of Texts I and III; word sälam in Text II; selected lines in all the texts (27vb, 105ra, 108va, 117vb); elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

(EMML VII, 38) (Within the compendium of Homilies by Rǝtuʿa Haymanot).

(EMML X, 318) (With “Dǝrsanä Mikaʾel” and other texts).

msItem.note: The church possesses the tabot of the Four Living Creatures. Perhaps the text was copied and included into the Ms. on the occasion of introduction of the (new) tabot into the church.

msItem.title: I. Gädlä Kiros “Vita of Kiros”
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the protagonist; name of the commissioner (fols. 3rb, 70vb, 90vb, 99rb); two initial lines in the incipit page of Texts I and III; word sälam in Text II; selected lines in all the texts (27vb, 105ra, 108va, 117vb); elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 3rab: በስመ፡”… ንቀድም፡ በረድኤተ፡ እግዚእነ ኢየሱስ ክርስቶስ፨ ገድል፡ ወስምዕ፡ ዘቅዱስ፡ ወብፁዕ፡ አባ፡ ኪሮስ መስተጋድል፨ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁሩ ጽጌ ሃይማኖት፡ ለዓለመ፡ዓለም አሜን፡፡ ወነበረ፡ በመንበረ፡ አቡሁ[fol. 3vb]ዮናኒ በምግባራተ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወኢያንተገ፡ እምኔሁ፨ ወነበረ፡ ፷ዓመተ፡ ወወለደ፡ ወልደ፡ ዘስሙ፡ አብያ፨ ወእምዝ አዕረፈ፡ አቡሁ በክብር፨ ወነበረ፡ አብያ፡ ዲበ፡ መንበረ፡ አቡሁ ወኢያንተገ፡ እምኔሁ፡ ወኢአሐተኒ፨ ወሰማ[sic]፡ ለብእሲቱ፡ ኒናሲር፡ ወነበረት፡ መካነ፡ ፴ዓመተ፨ ወእምዝ፡ ጸለዩ፡ ኀበ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወፀንሰት፡ በጊዜ፶፡ ወወለደት፡ መንታ᎒Fol. 5rab: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. We shall begin, with the help of our Lord Jesus Christ, the vita and testimony (to the faith) of the holy and blessed father Kiros, an ascetic. May his prayer and blessing be with his beloved Ṣəge Haymanot, forever and ever, Amen.
msItem.explicit: Fol. 90vb: ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ ለአባ፡ ኪሮስ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁሩ፡ ጽጌ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ወምስለ፡ ዓመቱ፡ አመተ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ምስለ፡ አሞየ፡ ወለተ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወምስለ፡ አቡየ፡ ቃለ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወምስለ፡ ጸሐፊሁ፡ ኃጥእ፡ ዘወልደ፡ ማርያም፡ ዘአጽሐፎ፡ በተአምኖ፡ ወምስለ፡ ኵልነ፡ ሕዝበ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨፨ ወተመጠዉ᎓እምሥጢራተ᎓ ቅድስት[fol. 91vb]:አባ᎓ ሰሞዖን᎓ ወአባ ባውሚን᎓ ወአባ በብኑዳ… ተፈጸመ፡ በዝየ፡ በሰላመ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ገድለ፡ አቡነ፡ ብፁዕ፡ ወክቡር፡ ኪሮስ፡ [fol. 92ra]ስብሐት፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ አምላክነ፡ ወለእሌነ[sic]፡ ይኩን፡ ሰህሎ[sic]፡ ወምህረቶ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨፨ ዘጸሐፎ፡ ወለዘአጽሐፎ፡ ለዘእንበቦ፡ ወለዘተርጐሞ፡ ወለዘሰምዓ፡ ቃላቲሁ፡ በዕዝኒ፡ መንፈስ፡ ወበኅሊና፡ ጽሩይ፡ ኅቡረ፡ ይምሐረነ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ ወአሜን፡ ለይኩን፡ ለይኩን፨Fol. 90vb: May the prayer and blessing of father Kiros be with his beloved Ṣəge Haymanot and with his maid ˀAmätä Śəllase, with my mother Wälättä Krəstos and with my father Qalä Krəstos and with the sinful scribe Zä-Wäldä Maryam, who caused it to be written in faith, and with all Christian people, forever and ever, Amen.

msItem.note: Marrassini (2004:79-81) refers to this version of the Vita of Kiros as the text of “type 1”, most commonly spread and contained in many Mss. It is different from the Vita of “type 2” which is attested in a few Mss. only (translated and published: B. Turaev, “Kopto-efiopskoe skazanie o prepodobnom Kire”, .R.Arhe­ologičeskago Obščestva 15, 1903, 1–14).

list.item:
10
XIII(10/fols. 118r-128v)>.
Perhaps the codex was originally composed of quires I-IX (Texts I-II); quires A and X-XIII (Text III) were added to it later, but still during the life time of Ṣǝge Haymanot, the original commissioner of the Ms.

supportDesc.condition: Originally, one pair of sewing stations was employed for holding together all quires of the Ms. Probably in the modern time, an (unskilled) binder loosened the first three quires and bound them again with nylon threads (?), using two holes in the centre fold of the quires, originally meant for tiedowns of the endbands, as the sewing stations. In the same way, he unsuccessfully tried to resew quires X-XIII. Holes are carefully amended on fols. 67, 86, 95.

layout.ab: Ruling and pricking are mostly visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

list.item: colon of two black dots and three red dashes (in-between, above, below) (e.g., 44ra, 55va, 59va);
colon with dashes above and below (esp. in the text by hand b, e.g., fols. 99rab,102vb, 104ra, 104vab, 107rab,109ra, 111rab, 111vab, 113vb, 114rb);
II. Nine dot asterisk (used throughout the Ms.);
III. A chain of three nine dot asterisks connected by means of two black lines and one red line (fol. 91vb);
three nine dot asterisks between two chains of black and red dots (fols. 92ra, 126va).
a chain of black and red dots (fols. 98rb).
two nine dot asterisks connected by means of two black lines with one thick red line in between (fol. 117vb, 126ra).

handNote.ab: Hand a: mediocre; hand b: mediocre

handDesc.handNote: quires I-IX (Zä-Wäldä Maryam): a bit less careful, somewhat deteriorating to the end of the Ms.
quires A, X-XIII (looking similar to hand a; it can not be excluded that the scribe was the same person).

list.item: - Numerous corrections written interlineally: e.g., fols. 21vab, 28rab, 48rb, 68vb. - Numerous erasures: e.g., fols. 48va, 49ra, 53ra. - Writing exercises: fol. 1r.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. One pair of sewing stations.
Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

origin.origDate: The Ms. was written by Zä-Wäldä Maryam who was active in the first half of the 18th cent. (s. the colophon of Ms. QSM-007 fol. 217rb.)

listBibl.bibl: Ms. previously unknown.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: Ṣǝge Haymanot is mentioned on fols. 90vb and 126ra. Other members of his family: his father Qalä Krǝstos, his mother Wälättä Krǝstos and his sister ʾAmätä Śǝllase are mentioned on fols. 90vb-91ra. The same family donated Ms. MKL-010.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
